metadata.title: CVE-2022-47952 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description: lxc-user-nic in lxc through 5.0.1 is installed setuid root, and may allowlocal users to infer whether any file exists, even within a protecteddirectory tree, because "Failed to open" often indicates that a file doesnot exist, whereas "does not refer to a network namespace path" oftenindicates that a file exists. NOTE: this is different from CVE-2018-6556because the CVE-2018-6556 fix design was based on the premise that "we willreport back to the user that the open() failed but the user has no way ofknowing why it failed"; however, in many realistic cases, there are noplausible reasons for failing except that the file does not exist.

criterions.comment: lxc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
